subtitle: This savoury flan can be served hot or cold.

method.text: Line a 33 cm x 10 cm rectangular loose-bottomed fluted flan tin.
Sift the flour and mustard into a bowl. Rub in the butter until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add enough cold water to form a soft but not sticky dough.
Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface and use to line the flan tin.  Trim off any excess pastry. Prick the base. Chill for 30 min.
Meanwhile, heat the oil in a frying pan. Add the garlic, pepper and courgette slices. Fry for 3-5 min until softened.
In a jug, mix together the cream, pesto, egg and seasoning.
Line the pastry case with greaseproof paper and baking beans and bake blind for 15 min.
Remove paper and beans. Cook for about 5 min until crisp and golden brown. Remove from oven. Leave to cool slightly.
Place the pastry case on a baking tray. Sprinkle the cheese and half the nuts over the pastry case. Arrange the pepper and courgette slices on top.
Sprinkle over the remaining nuts. Pour in the cream mixture slowly. Allow to settle.
Return to the oven and cook for 35-40 min until set and golden.
Serve hot or cold in slices.
